## ChannelOptions interface

Advanced settings to configure a gRPC client.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface ChannelOptions 
```

</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Set to `0` to prevent the client from retrying requests.


</td></tr>

</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The time between the first and second connection attempts (in milliseconds).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

["grpc.keepalive\_permit\_without\_calls"?](./grpc.channeloptions._grpc.keepalive_permit_without_calls_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Set to `1` to send keepalive pings from the client without any outstanding streams.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

["grpc.keepalive\_time\_ms"?](./grpc.channeloptions._grpc.keepalive_time_ms_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Duration (in milliseconds) after which client pings the server to see if the transport is still alive.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

["grpc.keepalive\_timeout\_ms"?](./grpc.channeloptions._grpc.keepalive_timeout_ms_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Duration (in milliseconds) after which to close the transport if a keepalive ping has not been acknowleged by the server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

["grpc.lb.ring\_hash.ring\_size\_cap"?](./grpc.channeloptions._grpc.lb.ring_hash.ring_size_cap_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Cap the minimum and maximum ring size values set in the load balander policy config to this value.


</td></tr>

["grpc.use\_local\_subchannel\_pool"?](./grpc.channeloptions._grpc.use_local_subchannel_pool_.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number \| undefined


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ If set to `0`<!-- -->, this channel uses the global subchannel pool. Otherwise, it uses a local subchannel pool within the channel.
